author: g11tech
content: i anyway added the tooling to just generate and post the bls change: `lodestar validator bls-to-execution-change --publicKey 0xF00... --fromBlsPrivkey ... --toExecutionAddress ...`  where the private key could come from thirdparty tooling like staking cli/ethdo

author: g11tech
content: the beacon apis for submission would anyway be available for use by the third party tools

author: g11tech
content: <@412614104222531604> you may use: `g11tech/lodestar:withdrawals-bls` for submitting/processing withdrawal addresses

author: barnabasbusa
content: <@144468805697929216> I'm a bit curious about one of the flags for the bls to execution command I have made the following call following your readme : ```docker run --network=host wealdtech/ethdo --connection 127.0.0.1:4000 validator credentials set --validator=2000 --mnemonic="change...lucky" --path='m/12381/3600/2000/0/0' --withdrawal-address=0xE7c180eAdA8f60D63e9671867b2e0CA2649207A8 --verbose``` but it looks like the --validator flag in this call gets totally rejected? Like if I use a totally random number as --validator=1 then it would still make the BLS change for 2000 as defined in the path. So then --validator can be omitted?

author: jgm
content: Yeah that flag can be omitted.  It can likely be removed, given the information is fully specified elsewhere.  I'll take a look and tidy up; thanks.

author: barnabasbusa
content: yeah would be good to have clear indication whether the validator index is used or the derivation path.

author: jgm
content: I've just pushed an update the checks that only one of `validator` `mnemonic` and `private-key` is supplied, otherwise things could be confusing.

author: barnabasbusa
content: I have created a small readme that keeps track of how to do full withdrawals with the different consensus clients and make a simple BLS to execution key change with ethdo. https://notes.ethereum.org/@bbusa/withdrawals Please let me know if you feel like I have missed something, and feel free to start testing whatever withdrawals types you want to do. I can provide the mnemonic to anyone that is interested to make a BLS to execution change.
